channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #58 - Back from a summer vacation and starting to work? Then Happy Labor day!
item.description:
Hi,

The summer is over, people are getting back to work slowly. To celebrate it the Americans take an extra day off. Enjoy!

In the meantime I made some changes to the newsletter: bigger fonts to make more readable and some colors just to be nicer.

Let me also thank Shlomi Fish who has been helping me getting rid of some of the biggest grammar issues in the newsletter. Thanks Shlomi and good luck with the debugger grant!

Other than that, we have some articles to read:

item.title: Why Did I Choose Perl When Building Crowdtilt
item.description: In a nutshell they like Perl and think CPAN is awesome. There is more to it in the article and at the end there is a link to the Hacker News discussion which can be also interesting.

item.title: Domain-Specific Languages made simpler
item.description: Another entry by Jeffrey Kegler using the Marpa parser, that can 'just parse' BNF to create a simple DSL.

item.title: Filtering values using Perl grep
item.description: The grep of Perl is a generalization of the grep of Linux. See how to use it.

item.title: Q: When not to use Regexp? A: HTML parsing
item.description: Lots of examples collected by Kirk Kimmel in Ruby, Python and Perl how bad it can be to parse HTML using regexes.

item.title: Citrus Perl 5.16.1 Released
item.description: Citrus Perl is a binary distribution of Perl created for GUI application developers. The distribution includes wxPerl, the Perl wrapper for wxWidgets.

item.title: Triceps an innovative CEP (Complex Event Processing) engine
item.description: It is writte in C++ and you can 'script it' using Perl.

item.title: Embed Perl5 to node.js
item.description: Synchronous but useful embed Perl for node.js

item.title: Running Perl tests in parallel with 'prove', with some exceptions
item.description: You can reduce the the testing time if you run your tests in parallel, but what if some of the tests have to be executed sequentially? Mark Stosberg found an undocumented flag of the prove command that can do just that.

item.title: Adding tests to and refactoring the perl debugger - report #1
item.description: The proposal of Shlomi Fish has just been approved for funding by The Perl Foundation and you can already read the first report.

item.title: Creating a Perl web application on dotCloud
item.description: David Oswald has worked on a project for being hosted on dotCloud and then presented his experience along with some examples to the Thousand Oaks Perl Mongers and to the Los Angeles Perl Mongers. He is sharing both the slides and the examples using Mojolicious.

item.title: A Rakudo Performance
item.description: This is the lightning talk Patrick Michaud gave at YAPC::NA 2012. This is what got me enthusiastic again that got me started the Perl 6 Maven site. Watch it only if you are not afraid of getting trapped in the world of Perl 6!

item.title: ANNOUNCE: Niecza Perl 6 v21 by Stefan O'Rear
A Rakudo Debugger
item.description: Jonathan Worthington had a surprise for the all the Perl 5 and Perl 6 developers when he showed this during YAPC::EU. In this article he explains how can you use the debugger.

item.title: Rakudo Star 2012.08 released
item.description: This is the regular, quarterly release of Rakudo Star that includes both the Perl 6 compiler and a bunch of external modules. It even contains the newly released debugger of Jonathan Worthington. (See above.)

item.title: Plat_Forms calls for Perl web developers - 7th Sept 2012 deadline
Perl 5 Porters Weekly: August 20-August 26, 2012
item.description: Highlights: Perl 5.17.3 is now available!; The latest Unicode 6.2 beta is now in blead; The great summary of how smartmatch changes. Again.

item.title: #perl6 summary for week ending 2012-08-25
item.description: An excellent compilation of the events on the Perl 6 development IRC channel. (Unfortunately we are one week off with this report, but I hope this can be fixed).

item.title: YAPC::EU::2012, the good parts
item.description: by Alberto Simoes

item.title: YAPC::Europe 2012
item.description: by Ovid

item.title: YAPC::EU 2012 - an organizers' view - Day 0
item.description: A bit late, but the YAPC::EU organizers have also started to publish their daily reports about the event. Day 0 and Day 1 have been published so far.

item.title: Perl Reunification Summit
item.description: This article is by Elizabeth Mattijsen (Liz) who, together with Wendy van Dijk organized the event. This includes the original mail she sent to a number of people outlining the problems she sees and what she would like to discuss at the PRS. This gives a good opportunity to understand the motivations.

item.title: YAPC::Asia Tokyo 2012
item.description: September 27-29, 2012, Tokyo, Japan

item.title: Portuguese Perl workshop (PTPW)
item.description: September 28, 2012, Braga, Portugal

item.title: Italian Perl workshop (IPW)
item.description: October 11-12, 2012, Bologna, Italy

item.title: Nordic Perl workshop (NPW)
item.description: October 13-14, 2012, Stockholm, Sweden
